pageContext.claim: “And the laws are a big problem. You know, they call one catch-and-release. You catch them and you release them...So they take their name and they say, You can go now. Come back in three years. You have a trial. This is the United States law, by the way. And made worse by the Ninth Circuit. The Ninth Circuit is a disaster.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump is routinely astonished by the workings of U.S. and international laws on asylum or misleadingly calls them "loopholes." This is how it works in any country that abides by the Universal Declaration of Human Rights and the United Nations Protocol Relating to the Status of Refugees: A refugee enters and makes a petition, and the government makes a ruling after analyzing the facts. It's also worth keeping in mind that 85 percent of all deportations in the United States are ordered quickly, without a hearing before a judge. Trump adds in a knock about the Ninth Circuit court of appeals, but he's wrong to say the court has made this worse.
